goal.en: Strategic management is an academic field that was gradually formalized after the 1970s, but the term "strategy" originated in ancient Greece. Also in the treacherous and ever-changing market, trade barriers between national borders are gradually disappearing, and the rapid advancement of technology has made structural changes in the originally stable industrial environment. The so-called "competitive advantage" can only be created by being quicker than others' actions.
goal.ch: 策略管理雖然是在1970年代後才逐漸正式化的學術領域，但「策略」一詞卻源自古希臘。同樣在詭譎多變的商場上，國界間的貿易壁壘逐漸消失，科技的突飛猛進使得原本穩定的產業環境出現結構性的變化，競爭的本質與步調使得任何組織必須以更宏觀的角度、明確的定位及迅於他人的行動，方能產生所謂「競爭優勢」。

content.en: "Strategy" is the overall guiding principles of related resources within the enterprise. This course teaches the procedures of strategic management, including strategy analysis, strategy formation and strategy implementation; that is, how an organization can surpass the thinking and means of competitors through goal setting and a series of closely integrated actions and resource allocation. This course includes the basic concepts of strategic thinking, how to compete in a specific field (competition strategy) and how to choose a field (growth strategy).
content.ch: 策略係統合企業內相關資源之整體性指導原則，和企業功能性之管理有極大的分野。本課程教授策略管理之程序，包括策略分析、策略形成與策略執行；亦即組織如何透過目標設定及進行一系列密切結合的行動與資源配置，俾能超越競爭對手的思維與手段。本課程包括策略思維的基本觀念、及如何在特定場域中競爭（競爭策略）與如何選擇場域（成長策略）等兩個層次。

textbook.en: 參考書：Hill, Schilling and Jones (2017), Strategic Management, Theory, 12th ed. (華泰代理)
textbook.ch: 參考書：湯明哲（2011）策略精論(基礎篇)、策略精論 (進階篇)，旗標出版社
